title: Catawampus Universe (NIGHT ONE) at The Burl
Storytelling Public Walks
brief_description: We have an opportunity to reimagine an inclusive public square reflective of contemporary values
description:
In the fall of 2017, two Confederate monuments located at the old Fayette County Courthouse and Cheapside—the site of an African- American slave auction block—were removed. This was a result of both recent and long-standing efforts by a wide range of forward-thinking Lexingtonians.


Subsequently, we have an opportunity to reimagine an inclusive public square reflective of contemporary values. (RE)IMAGINING CHEAPSIDE is a placemaking project intended to build inclusion and healing into the site. Blue Grass Community Foundation is proud to be a partner in this initiative, along with the city of Lexington, Hensley Agency -- State Farm Insurance, and Take Back Cheapside community organizers. Together with internationally recognized author and placemaker Jay Pitter, several placemaking initiatives—intended to build healing and inclusion into the site—are being undertaken. The upcoming Public Storytelling Walks is one of these initiatives. 


This initiative will feature the painful and undertold history related to Cheapside while celebrating wonderful contributions made by African-Americans. Additional walks will celebrate a wide range of Lexingtonians who contribute to making the city a great place on a daily basis:


A farmer unearths his passion for food justice working in a collective urban garden.


A local leader retraces his steps up the fire escape of a formerly segregated movie theatre.


Artists transform the streets into a canvas exploring beauty and interconnectedness.


A family invites us into their living room to share how opening personal space strengthens neighborhood bonds.


All of the walks promise to be engaging and informative; attend one or all of the following: 


African American Walk | Friday August 10 | 7:00pm-8:30pm

Starting Point: Lyric Theatre & Cultural Arts Center — 300 E Third St, Lexington, KY 40508 


African American Walk | Saturday August 11 | 11:00am-12:30pm

Starting Point: Henry Clay Public House — 112 N Upper St, Lexington, KY 40507


Beauty & Sustainability Walk | Saturday August 11 | 2:00pm-3:30pm

Starting Point: The Living Arts & Science Center — 362 Martin Luther King Blvd, Lexington, KY 40508


Belonging Walk | Sunday August 12 | 11:00am-1:30pm

Starting Point: Maria's Kitchen — 805 N Broadway, Lexington, KY 40508 


While you do not need to RSVP for these walks, we encourage you to visit https: www.bgcf.org/events to let us know you’ll be joining us and get a sneak peak at the wonderful Lexingtonians who’ll be sharing their stories and insights.

title: A Palindrome Reading with Pauletta Hansel
brief_description: Join Pauletta Hansel for a reading from the book on this year’s Palindrome Day
description: Palindrome refers to a word or sequence of words or numbers that read the same whether from the beginning or the end. Pauletta Hansel’s poetry collection, Palindrome, explores the ways in which her mother’s decline into dementia created a palindrome within their relationship. Join her for a reading from the book on this year’s Palindrome Day, 8/10/2018….

title: Catawampus Universe (NIGHT TWO) at The Burl
CRAVE Lexington Food + Music Festival 2018
brief_description: Crave Lexington offers a weekend full of fun for the entire family
description:
6th Annual CRAVE Lexington food + music festival.


Featuring dozens of food vendors from across the Commonwealth, two days of live music, food presentations emceed by Food Network star Jason Smith, bounce houses, art activities, a classic car show, beer, wine and locally crafted cocktails, and much, much more. Crave Lexington offers a weekend full of fun for the entire family.


Admission: $8 (kids 10 & under free)

Parking: Free

Food: Vendors will offer items at $2, $3 & $5 price points

Music: Included with admission.

Bounce houses and other kids’ activities: Included with admission.


What food will be there?

Food is at the epicenter of CRAVE! This year's fest will feature more than 50 vendors, from fine dining establishments to our favorite local holes in the wall. 


What music will be there?

The 2018 music stage will feature a variety of great local and regional acts, from Americana, blues and Motown to punk-inspired bluegrass and psychedelic blues. 


Is CRAVE kid-friendly?

Absolutely! CRAVE Lexington is a family-friendly event with lots of activities for every age group. Kids' programming includes inflatables, face painting, games, hands-on art projects and more. A nursing tent will be available on-site for nursing mothers. 


Who created CRAVE?

Presented by Windstream, CRAVE Lexington is a 2-day food + music festival produced by Smiley Pete Publishing, the independent Lexington-based company behind Chevy Chaser and Southsider Magazines, Business Lexington, Lexington Burger and Pizza Week, Bluegrass BBQ Festival and tadoo.com.


Does CRAVE support a charity?

CRAVE Lexington partners with several charities during the festival, with GreenHouse 17 receiving the largest portion of festival proceeds of all of our non-profit partners. In 2015, 2016 & 2017 CRAVE Lexington contributed over $33,000 to local charities.

title: Talena Sanders: New Movies
brief_description: Talena Sanders returns to Lexington to show two new films
description:
Talena Sanders returns to Lexington to show two new films, 'Between my flesh and the world's fingers' and 'Reasonable Watchfulness.' Like her earlier films, they use the texture of hand-processed motion picture film to reflect on the experience of history, both social and personal. Sanders will attend the screening and do a Q&A after the show.


Between my flesh and the world's fingers (2018), 31.5 minutes.


'Mary MacLane, the Wild Woman of Butte, Montana, published her diaries in 1902 and 1917. As an out queer and proto-feminist at the turn of the century, MacLane became notorious upon the publication of her 1902 diary, I Await the Devil’s Coming. She was whisked away from the industrial hellscape of her copper mining Montana hometown to a life in the public eye as an author, journalist, female film pioneer and always a provocateur - sending up social norms throughout her career, with a special focus on staid notions about women and sexuality.'


'Between my flesh and the world’s fingers is an experimental essay and diary film primarily based on her published diaries and her film work. Though the film is not directly a personal film, the production is founded in part in the act of a woman telling her own story through that of another woman, a trailblazing figure from the past.'


Reasonable Watchfulness (2018) 8 minutes.


'Transitions while longing for other places and people, like a fox on the run.'

title: Love, Peace, and Hair Grease - a Creative Crossover Event
brief_description: The Creative Crossover series, a partnership with Shift Lexington and LexUX, were we highlight local creatives that cross the strict divides of a typical job title.
description:
Creativity reveals itself in many different ways; design, architecture, painting, music, entrepreneurship… to name a few. As a part of the Creative Crossover series, a partnership with Shift Lexington and LexUX, we highlight local creatives that cross the strict divides of a typical job title. This month, we are featuring Jason Glass, co-owner of Cha Cha’s and the Rooster’s Nest, a local salon and barber shop. Jason will share his wisdom and great stories with us inside their shop. Join us for a great conversation, drinks, snacks, and the opportunity to learn more about a Lexington gem.



Jason Bio


Jason Glass has been a colorist and hair stylist for over two decades. Originally from the Muscle Shoals area of Alabama he spent his younger years as a military brat - attending 11 different schools and visiting every continent but the North and South Pole.  Jason, his wife Cha Cha, and their business partner Zac, opened their salon Cha Cha’s in 2008 and The Rooster’s Nest Barber Shop in 2013. Both shops have become a staple for locals and hair industry followers alike.


He is an award winning salon owner, education director,  product developer and stunt double.


What is the Creative Crossover series?


Creative Crossover is a quarterly event created by Shift Lexington and LexUX. Through these events, we highlight creative professionals that blur the lines of your standard job title and description with a variety of events. Any creative person knows that just because your job says you do this one thing, doesn’t mean, on a daily basis, you don’t touch many other areas and fields. Your knowledge is amazing and only experience and grit will get you there. You can look for a Creative Crossover event at least three times a year and you can count on our annual holiday event in December to celebrate the year’s accomplishments and cheer in the new goals.


Past Creative Crossover events include, How Many Hats Do You Wear? a panel discussion, Design + Space, and of course, our Holiday Party.

title: The 2018 Woodland Art Fair
brief_description: Featuring over 200 artists, enjoy live music, Kentucky food, beer gardens, and family friendly art engagement activities - all available with free admission
description:
The Lexington Art League and Lexington, KY Parks & Recreation proudly present the 43rd Annual Woodland Art Fair, August 18-19, 2018, on the beautiful Woodland Park grounds (601 East High Street, Lexington, KY 40502).


Featuring over 200 artists, enjoy live music, Kentucky food, beer gardens, and family friendly art engagement activities - all available with free admission! 


Woodland Art Fair has received several national, regional & local honors including being voted a Top 200 Fine Art & Design Show in the nation 2007-2017 by Sunshine Artist Magazine, a Top 20 Event by The Southeast Tourism Society, a Top 10 Festival by The Kentucky Travel Industry Association, and voted as a finalist by readers in the Kentucky Living 2017 Best in Kentucky contest.


Produced in partnership by Lexington Art League and Lexington, KY Parks & Recreation.


Special thanks to this year's Lead Sponsors:

title: George Clinton & the Parliament Funkadelic
brief_description: The Lyric Theatre is pleased to announce George Clinton and the Parliament Funkadelic
description:
The Lyric Theatre is pleased to announce George Clinton and the Parliament Funkadelic to hit the Lyric Theatre Stage on Thursday, August 23.


Tickets are set at $65 Advance $70 Day Of plus ticket fees. Individual tickets will go on sale to the public on Monday, April 30 at 2 pm.


Currently, you can purchase the 'We Want The Funk' Ticket Package. This package includes 2 Best Seats in the House, 2 Funk Fridays passes, 2 Lyric T-shirts, 2 Lyric Concession Drinks, and 2 $2 Popcorn Bags for just $100 plus ticket fees. 


'We Want The Funk' Ticket Package will be available only from Friday, April 20 to Friday, April 27 at 5 pm. Limited number of ticket packages available.

title: Small Time Napoleon
brief_description: Small Time Napoleon is the combination of new ideas and old sounds. Their interest in the jazz standards of the swing-era shine through in their voices, writing, and playing, while their ear for new sounds and ideas constantly drives them forward
description: Small Time Napoleon is the combination of new ideas and old sounds. Their interest in the jazz standards of the swing-era shine through in their voices, writing, and playing, while their ear for new sounds and ideas constantly drives them forward. The product of this pairing is what Kyle Ware of Insider Louisville has called “a mad science blend of western swing, hot jazz and folk,” which is “already starting to gel into something wholly singular.”

title: Bit Brigade Performs Mega Man II + Castlevania
brief_description: Bit Brigade performs rock covers of full NES game soundtracks as their gamer speedruns the game live on stage
description:
New Cosmic location TBA


Bit Brigade performs rock covers of full NES game soundtracks as their gamer speedruns the game live on stage. 


'When was the last time you attended a live music performance with a genuine element of risk involved? And no, going to a Gwar show with a white t-shirt on doesn't count. When Bit Brigade takes the stage your mind will frantically oscillate between 'Oh! Agh!! Please don't die!!' and 'YES! He's doing it!!' Combining the dread and daring of a live video game speed run with the spot-on technique of a live band covering the musical accompaniment to everything you're seeing on-screen in real time, Bit Brigade will have you swinging between the two mediums. From thrashing about to live renditions of your favorite stage themes, fingers yearning to the sky in a rock 'n roll parody of sea anemones seeming to silently plead, 'Please, feed us more fretboard pyrotechnics!,' to being locked in stock-still rapture as the infallible maestro of the d-pad, Noah McCarthy, takes on the final boss and risks his video game life under the threat of intense peer scorn (or the reward of night-long glory and a credits score). No matter the outcome, Bit Brigade must play on until the deed is done - which it always is - on the first (and last) try. Once Noah’s NES buzzes on, there’s no turning back.' - Metalhead Mike of The Shizz, summer 2011

title: Funk Fridays featuring DeBraun Thomas
description:
Funk Fridays featuring DeBraun Thomas


Friday, September 21, come out to the Lyric Theatre for Funk Fridays. Fun 4 Everyone will begin at 6:00 PM, where kids and their families can enjoy family fun time. Starting at 8 PM, Funk Fridays will officially begin in the Deweese Street Community Room. 


Tickets are set for $5.00. Children 12 and under are free. Please contact the Lyric Box Office at 859-280-2218 for more information or to purchase your tickets.


We would like to thank our partners who made this possible, Together Lexington.

title: Kentucky Fried Zine Fest 6
brief_description: KFZ is back with another day of zines, comics and more!
description:
KFZ is back with another day of zines, comics and more! This year we have partnered with Institute 193 and UK's School of Art & Visual Studies. We are excited to bring in makers from all over the country to show their work and educate others about what they do. 


This event is FREE and open to the public. For information on becoming an exhibitor, visit www.kfzines.org


Stay tuned for information about workshops, performances and other special events.
